The Half-Life universe is my favorite.
Seit Jahrzehnten einer der Besten Shooter

This game is only half as good as the first Half Life, but it is still an amazing experience nonetheless. There is decent enemy variety, fun and interesting puzzles, and an incredible story to boot. But most everyone already knows that.
What irks me about Half Life 2 is it's insistence on vehicular gameplay, when the source engine simply does not handle vehicles well. The airboat and buggy section of the game are dismal; they were enough to turn away a friend of mine from ever even attempting to finish this game. Though while I can't speak for everyone on this, I can pretty safely say that chapters like Highway 17 and Water Hazard are Half Life at its worst. Even still, Half Life at its worst is still better than most things you can waste your time playing, so take all of that negative drivel with a grain of salt and give this thing a try if you haven't already!
The best sequel to one of the best games.

Sonido: De lo mejor del juego, destacando las explosiones y el sonido ambiente. El dobleja de algunos personajes no me convence. Sene olmu≈ü 2021 hala keyifle, sƒ±kƒ±lmadan, rahatlƒ±kla oynayabiliyorum. √áok seviyorum Half-Life serisini. √ñlmeden √∂nce oynanacaklar oyunlar listenize ekleyin derim.

Playing this for the first time, especially with the leap in technology and visuals of character models and such, gave me a lot to appreciate as I gazed in awe of it all. The final stretch gave me what I loved in the Portal games and similarly to Portal 2 a really cool environment for a stellar ending. 

The enemy have frustratingly too good aim again for any difficulty you play on. And the first part of the game I thought how do people like this so much? And why didn't they call this game boat drive adventure? For the amount of time and distance you travel almost aimlessly in a cart, even leaving the thing at one point to trek on foot, only to find I needed it to progress with the thing and it's walk all the way back to use it's float-y mechanics, but gladly this ended and didn't come back. I can see why people love this game and hold it so highly regarded, though moments didn't capture me emotionally like people say that it did for them. 

I like how the game takes you on a journey and the funniest moment of this for me is when a character you are travelling with decided it best to scale a four storey building to find a way through a blocked road only to be captured as they reach the top. What a coincidence!

Decent story with some neat moments to experience, best of all were in the Ravenholm mission.
